document_data.name: Valashar
document_data.mainbody: '''County Valashar''', or '''Lathmarch''', was known as the "'''Gate to the Highlands'''" of [[Tethyr]]. Located roughly in the southern reaches of the historic [[Valashar (kingdom)|kingdom of the same name]], Valashar had a large population of monsters.
document_data.Geography:
Valashar was one of the [[Golden Marches]].

The county rose high above sea level, over 2,000 feet (600 meteres), and was at the highest elevation of any other region of Tethyr. The [[Tethir Road]] passed through its lands.
document_data.Government: In [[1370 DR]], the Siegelord of Tethyr's armies, Count [[Holver Roaringhorn]] ruled Valashar from the manor of [[Tannithall]].
document_data.History: After the defection of [[Riatavin]] from Amn to Tethyr in [[1370 DR]], the county grew in size. It also grew in unrest, as the [[Zaranda Star|queen]] ordered many of her troops into that county in case war with Amn could not be averted.

Notable Locations.[[Asharfall]]: an estate that formerly was in Amnian lands
Notable Locations.[[Rhianna]]: an estate that formerly was in Amnian lands
Notable Locations.[[Shelshyr House]]: the ducal seat of the Golden Marches
Notable Locations.[[Sunrise Orchards]]: a plantation that formerly was in Amnian lands
